name: Native Biodiversity & Taxa Richness
functionStatement: Species interactions sustain biodiversity, restrain invasives, and build resilience to disturbance.
descriptionMarkdown: "Longitudinal connectivity and aquatic organism passage; barriers can limit recolonization, migration, and gene flow. Quick sample shows multiple families (incl. EPT) unless dryness/high-altitude limits diversity. Most historically native fish/inverts remain, unless naturally low-diversity (headwaters, ephemeral)."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel and Watershed; Channel

Method: Field screening and/or Desktop (databases); Field
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Inventory potential barriers (culverts, dams, grade controls) within the specified upstream/downstream distance using barrier datasets and imagery; confirm passability where feasible. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Compute major group richness from a kick-net sample or use existing biological records where available. Compare observed fish and invertebrate lists to available historical records or reference expectations."

inputs.label: Native Biodiversity & Taxa Richness
inputs.helpMarkdown: "Barrier inventories (state/federal/NGO), NHD/NHDPlus hydrography, recent imagery, and field verification where feasible. "

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Four to five or more distinct major groups. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Two to four distinct major groups. / One to two distinct major groups. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Zero, or only one extremely tolerant group. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: USGS BioData and/or state biomonitoring datasets
EPA Water Quality Portal biological results (where available).
state Natural Heritage Program lists and records.
